Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Rachelle E
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly & we were glad for the good size mini suite. although the hotel was under construction we found this to be of little hassle. The closeness to BH/Hollywood/Universal made this an affordable & adequate hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was fine for what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Kim J
Reviews.Content: I also had this hotel assigned to me on Hotwire. Not the nicest accommodation no, but I was clean, no bugs. It could definitely use a remodel though the rooms are old in need of new carpet and wallpaper,bathrooms are old and need new tiles. I will say this though the location to everything is awesome and the staff are super nice and helpful. I left my cell phone there and they had it mailed to me very quickly after I sent them postage. In two days from the time I left, I had it back in my hands. I felt safe while I was there. If the they just renovated it, it would be a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hole”
Reviews.Author: Darren M
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay urgently as my preferred accommodation suddenly became unavailable. After a short internet search this place seemed reasonable and very affordable. I wanted a pool as my partner would be alone during the day for a few days. And the location was desirable. I actually rang and made my booking and everything seemed fine. Apon arrival I noticed that the spot where I thought the pool would be was dug up and men were working with jack hammers. I immediately asked the man booking us in and he rudely informed us that they were renovating and that there was no pool. I asked him why the pool was still on their website, and also why I wasn't informed when I rang the day before, I was informed that I should have asked about the pool and received a rude shrug. It was too late to move elsewhere. The room was worst than I thought for a hotel at this price. It was reasonably clean. The bathroom was horrible with tiles missing, a strange smell and the shower grubby. On the second night we returned to the room late in the evening to find that the room had been serviced but no towels had been left out. I rang reception and was rudely told to come down and they would be given. I did that and was questioned about whether the do not disturb sign had been left out and therefore the room had not been serviced. When I explained that the room had been serviced and that the sign had not been left out, I was again rudely told that he would check with house cleaning in the morning and that I would be charged if it was not correct. Unbelievable!! I would never stay here again and recommend that it be avoided at all costs. There is plenty of nearby accommodation nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people make out”
Reviews.Author: JimmUK
Reviews.Content: After getting this motel assigned to us on hot-wire we were very worried and tried to change to a different one. When we got there the motel was fine, the staff were friendly and called taxis for us, moved us to a different room when we asked because we wanted a fridge, the rooms were clean enough and there were no bugs. Location is great to get to all the main parts of Hollywood. If we would have read the reviews first we would not have picked this place but it was decent enough and great value. Don't be put off by the bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Reward stay for WHAT?!?!”
Reviews.Author: RunningJock
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to get away for a 2-day stay in LA. I had the points and wanted to save money for this mini-getaway so I chose the Econo Lodge in Hollywood. Good idea just not a good hotel. The customer service from the front desk was almost non existent. The room was very cheap and the bathroom was ridiculous! The tile in the shower was decaying and peeling off and there wasn't even an outlet in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and I loved the firm pillows though. I saw the housekeepers who I felt sorry for because they had to work at this hotel. My quick interaction with them was nice though. I want my points back! :-(

Reviews.Title: “I also got scabies!! Do NOT stay here if you care about your health”
Reviews.Author: nyclala
Reviews.Content: I am seriously considering suing this place. I needed an inexpensive place to stay for one night in Hollywood, so I logged onto Hotwire and put in a bid. For $65 plus tax, I won this place. I really wish I could go back and do it all over again. If I had known that $65 plus tax plus $9 in parking was going to cost me so much in doctor visits, medication, and the extreme psychological torture of knowing that parasites are living under my skin and possibly infecting everything I wear and touch, I would have gladly spent $500 and stayed elsewhere. When I checked into the room, everything looked clean and respectable. Sure, it was shabby but there were fresh towels laid out and the sheets looked laundered. The sheets may have even been laundered, but evidently they were not washed or dried with heat because in the middle of the night during my one night stay there, I started scratching and have not stopped since. I will spare you the details of the disease, but just google "Scabies" if you really want to know what is in store for you if you stay at this motel. My whole life has been sidelined by this horrible, debilitating infection. If you care about your health and your quality of life, please DO NOT STAY HERE. Even if you booked this motel on priceline or hotwire and have already paid, DO NOT STAY HERE. Find another place to stay and just eat the lost money or try to get a refund from priceline or hotwire. Just do not stay here. I only wish I could go back in time and that someone could have warned me!

Reviews.Title: “2 people from our group got scabies.”
Reviews.Author: calichick06
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend going to this hotel, they obviously don't keep it very clean if two people in our group got scabies. The hotel was okay looking cleanliness wise when we arrived, but we know now to not trust the sheets at all.

Reviews.Title: “The pictures the hotel shows must be from a mystery room”
Reviews.Author: crlillian
Reviews.Content: I knew staying in an Econo Lodge, I was going to be staying in a very basic motel. I had made the reservation well ahead of the day of my arrival, and I received a room with 2 queen beds instead of 1 king bed. I had to pay a service fee of $20 dollars and I asked what the fee was for since I didn't have a car to park, the employee told me that it was just a fee they charged. When I booked the room online, I thought the pictures that were posted looked like the rooms were fine, but in reality they are not. The room was one where you just wanna put the bedspreads on the floor to walk because the floor is kinda nasty. The bathroom tiles had about three different coats of paint on them....all different colors....LOL! That must be what they call renovations. Being in a ground floor room, I could hear the ceiling creaking alot, and pieces chipping away. Here is the best part......I was in the lobby sitting one afternoon and a man walked in and went to the front desk. He asked if they rented rooms by the hour. The employee at the counter told the man that it would be $50 cash. The guy paid the cash and got a keycard from the employee. I had actually only seen stuff like that in the movies, that was the first time seeing that in person. I think there is an employee there that is making some extra money on the side by renting the rooms by the hour and charging mysterious service fees.

Reviews.Title: “Lies, lies...”
Reviews.Author: Akis1966
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from ratestogo.com and there were no reviews there. I had to read tripadvisor...a big mistake of me! I payed 80$ per day ahd for this hotel these are lots of money. The staff acted like they did not wanted you there, they tried to overcharge me because they did not recognized the deposit to ratestogo.com (finally they recognized it) and they said to me that they are Hollywood, they are always full and do not want clients from internet (!) and the site book their rooms without asking them!!!!. Room was dirty, had no fridge, no iron, no micro and I PAYED for these amenities. Parking cost (at site $5 a day, but when I arrived there they told me to pay about $10 due to taxes. The surroundings are the same as hotel, terrible. By the way, Hollywood is a big lie also....only advertisement

Reviews.Title: “Econo - more than economy”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: Most of the negative reviews on here are true and I would urge caution to staying here. There are several different rates available and I found the best rate on eayclick travel but for the price paid it was disgusting. The room I staying in for 6 nights was 107, hardly any day light and dingy. The bathroom only had a walk in shower that was peeling and cracked. The linen had holes in. The motel seems to attract many drunks and loud behaviour all through the night, not to mention the smell of dope. The rooms are basic and if you are only staying a night or 2 and pay around $50 a night then it could just pass but I would definitely not recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “When it says 4 stars, divide by 2 and take 1 away - its that bad....”
Reviews.Author: Bignbeefy
Reviews.Content: Well it started badly, when we checked in, we had pre-ordered a cot for our 11 month old baby. The guy on the counter told us he had one, but it was broken. It was advertised as 4 star hotel and to be honest it struggled to meet 2 star standards. The shower was disgusting, actually the whole bathroom was pretty much in a state of disrepair and basically not up to the hygiene standards you would expect in the USA. When we got there I nearly crashed our car (well beached really!) in the car park. It was dark and the only space that was left had a massive drop in the middle of it that I couldnt see with the light available. The bottom of the car ground on the floor - dont tell Thrifty!!! I didnt do the complimentary "continental breakfast", but it was by far the worst of our trip with absolutely nothing of any substance. There was no fridge in our room either. We stayed one night and if the rest of Hollywood was not booked out or extortionate prices I wouldn't have even stayed that long! They did take $ 20 off for not having a cot available for us, so that was something.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: sweetdreams0703
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the motel to check in we were suprised to find that we had to pay a service fee for the internet, parking and possibly the complimentary breakfast. I can't remember exactly how much the fee was, I believe it was about $20 or $30. The room was pretty standard, a king sized bed, mini fridge, phone, alarm clock, bathroom. We stayed there for a week and didn't have any major concerns. Our room cards deactivated a few times that week, it was just more of a hassle, but only took a couple minutes to fix. The service at the front desk could be slow at times depending on who was working. There was one guy with short, straight, black hair that always managed to disappear in the back room. This was extremely annoying as we had to check out the one morning around 5am and we rang ther bell for nearly five minutes trying to get his attention. The pool was hardly ever in use but it was clean. There was no heater to control the temperature. They have one computer in the lobby with internet access that can be used during the day by guests. This motel is in walking distance of the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Grauman Theatre, Kodak centre.

Reviews.Title: “If you want nasty crap...this is it!!”
Reviews.Author: maksenova
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with two queens, the room itself was pretty large, but the bathroom was none existent. The towels had hair stuck to them, and there was a pubic hair in the shower when we got there. The tiles have mold, and cracks. Wouldn't advise to walk barefoot. I'm not sure if they wash the sheets after previous tenants, but deffinetely not during our stay, which was for 5 days and 4 nights. On our 3rd day the toilet clogged. It was nasty!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, Not Awful!”
Reviews.Author: 77pearl
Reviews.Content: There were absolutely no electrical outlets in the bathroom. I had to dry my hair in the room. Good luck if you shave with an electric razor in front of the mirror! There was a pedestal sink in the bathroom, which meant no place to put your toiletries on the bathroom counter. This hotel was right on Sunset Blvd which was good and bad. Good is that it was close to everything. Close to Griffith Park, Holleywood Blvd (Walk of Fame, Mann's Chinese Theater and souvenier shops). Bad is that we heard lots of ambulance and fire trucks in the two evenings we were at the motel. That wasn't unbearable though because it seemed to end by 10pm (of course this was on a Mon and Tue night). No bathtub just a shower. Restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Worst motel ever!”
Reviews.Author: wilkinslloyd
Reviews.Content: Between the postage-stamp-sized towels (2 total), the peeling paint, the dim light bulbs, the terrible continental breakfast, the attempt to charge for parking, the noise, and the expense...the was our Worst Motel Ever. There are lots of other choices in the neighborhood. Use 'em!

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to see or do not go”
Reviews.Author: babochka
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 3 nights. Place needs a major repair. Just because places to stay are very expencive around (close to Hollywood) they still stay in business/ But owner (manager?) was trying his best to accomodate us. For more than 100 per night you will get murky, old, cheap room and chipped tiles in a shower, comfortable beds, frige, microwawe, TV (never turned it on). I could not believe my eyes (thinking: what the dump!) and will never stay there again. Also walls are too thin. All 3 nights we heard somebody's steps upstairs, floor were very noisy and actually we could hardly sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Little Sketchy”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: I won this motel as a 1* Priceline hotel for about $60, including fees. The location is OK, but the room had problems: missing baseboard molding, no clock radio, a broken toilet paper holder, the bathroom mirror was hung from the towel rack, several cigarette burn holes in my blanket and there was an overall musty smell pervading the room, like they were trying to cover up mold. It's seemed as though they started to renovate my room and quit 75% of the way through. Plus, I never got a receipt for anything I paid for like parking ($5) or local phone calls. The complimentary breakfast was your basic coffee and danish, which is a nice touch considering how cheap the rooms are. The staff was OK, too but I would not want to stay here again and I'm not that picky. It's budget (low budget?) with a capital "B".

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague!!!”
Reviews.Author: onlyforkc
Reviews.Content: This was, without a doubt, one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. When I first arrived, they gave me a room on the first floor that smelled so strongly of pine-sol and bug spray that my eyes watered. I began to understand why when I saw roaches outside that were so big you could have strapped on a saddle and rode them. I asked to be moved up to the second floor. It was a little bit better, but not much. I wore socks when I walked around so my feet wouldn't get dirty, and I wore flip-flops in the shower. I felt like I was in college again! They weren't strict on the rules since there was a hispanic family that stayed in the King room next to me with 8 people in it! No joke! The management and the price were fine. That was about the only thing going for this hotel! I'd recommend spending a little bit more money and getting something more decent. It's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever been in!”
Reviews.Author: SandiGayl
Reviews.Content: We prepaid our room a month in advance, but when we arrived at 1:50 AM (late because of an Amtrak mess up), we were told our room was gone. I argued that a 3-night prepaid reservation could not be sold away and the clerk relented saying he had 1 room left, but it was with 1 bed, not the 2-bed I had paid for. We were desperate and took it. The carpeting was wet from a leaking bathroom sink; there was no bathtub; the shower had black mold on the ceiling and floor; we requested a wakeup call, but none came. When we went to the lobby the next day to ask for a room change and ask why no wakeup call, the clerk said their electronic system was not working; continental breakfast consisted of coffee and cinnamon rolls only. We will never stay at an Econo Lodge after this experience. This hotel was totally unworthy of the average night rate of $100. You can get a good hotel room in Ohio for $100 a nite, but obviously not in California!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sweets786
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much, but the room was reasonably clean and the water pressure in the shower was very high. The room had a musty smell, but a little AirWick fixed that problem. It does get loud at times, but I got this room for $40/night from Priceline plus $5/night for parking. It is a pretty convenient location and right for the price. I wanted clean, I got clean.

Reviews.Title: “EconoLodge on Sunset: Good Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PVJennybean
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the EconoLodge Hotel & Suites Hollywood for four days last week. This hotel is actually in an excellent locale to access the prime areas along Sunset Boulevard (it's situated at 7370 W. Sunset), and walking distance to shopping, restaurants, coffeeshops and likely some good star sighting if you're so inclined (I was not). It's maybe a 20 minute walk from Hollywood Boulevard as well, with it's attractions and access to the Hollywood/Highland Metroline Red underground train station. The rooms are not the Ritz or the Four Seasons so don't expect that. What they are is clean and functional. The hotel itself is at the tail end of a sprucing up and there is new paint, bedding, carpeting and a new lobby in progress. There is a small pool in the front that is fenced off with tables and an umbrella. Our room had two queen beds, a small bar fridge, a microwave, closet and drawers, and a small bathroom with shower - no tub. The rooms also have small in-room safes you can program with a passcode to lock, included in your room price. Very handy. Clientele seemed to range from young twentysomethings to families. The walls aren't extraordinarily thick, and I often heard the television in the room next door. It wasn't an issue for me, but for some it might be so be forewarned. The staff were efficient and unobtrusive, and I had absolutely no complaints about cleanliness. If you have noise issues when you sleep don't stay here, as you are right on Sunset and there IS traffic. It's right across the street from the huge Guitar Center. Seeing as we were here during what they deemed "low season" our room rates were around $70US/night with tax included. I suspect rates go up during the summer months and around holidays. For the price we paid the room was great, I would probably stay there again if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Outstanding Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: lacouple33
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Econlodge Inn & Suites Hollywood, the entire place was great. The rooms were beautiful, service was excellent, parking was not a problem, especially considering how difficult it can be in Hollywood. Very easy access to all attractions -everything was within 20 minutes. We stayed in December of 2005 and again in February of 2006 with two kids...couldnt ask for a nicer place at such a great price. The Front Desk clerk, Rodrigo, went out of his way to direct us in what to see and the best times to see it. The Housekeeping staff was really great too! My wife was concerened about our youngest, 5 years of age, who has asthma. On occasion in the past we've have issues with dust and the overall sanitary condition of Hotel Rooms, but the Econolodge worked out great. We did have problem with the T.V but Rodrigo took care of the problem expeditiously; not a problem though as I have problems at my own home and nobody comes running to fix it as quickly as they did at the Econolodge. I would recommend the Econolodge to anyone looking for an economical Hotel directly on Sunset Strip - virtually in the midde of all that is Hollywood!!!

Reviews.Title: “Total Health Hazzard! Avoid this place at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in my lifetime. This is by far the absolute worst hotel in The United States of America. The bathrooms had extreme mold and caused my son problems breathing when he showered. We had to take him to the hospital. The tiolet overflowed when we got there and the heater broke. With proof of the hospital bill the Econo Lodge home office will not refund our money for the stay. Please avoid this hotel if you care for the safety of your family and your health.

HotelInfo.Name: Sunset Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 7370 West Sunset Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90046
